column3: u'Transfer and reconcile new recropped images'
column4: u'Many of the original images were distorted.\r\n\r\nKelly did not know we could just overwrite the old bad images with the new ones
column5: so she gave the recropped images new/different slugs

column3: u'Refine and upload corrected data from Categories and Nominees spreadsheets'
column4: u'This takes a considerable amount of time to get the data into the proper format with each iteration. It would be nice to have to do it only once.'
column12: 'comment_body': u"There's going to be one more of these when John and Kelly rewrite the blurbs."

column3: u'Enter list of questions/requests into github'
column4:
u"HERE's the list:


what happens if the photo is a vertical (as a red carpet shot is likely to be)?
I can make a version that is vertical
column5:
or I can have the horizontal layout with the vertical picture on the left hand side with the caption on the right (or some variation of that)

Is it responsive?
It is currently in Bootstrap
column6:
which is responsive. But let's talk specifics of what you are expecting.

What will the final card look like?
I don't know
column7: I have to do a layout design for that. Again
column8: let's talk specifics of what you might want
column9:
and I can build it.

Can we turn off the auto advance?
Yes.

Can the slide advance after you hit the thumbs up or down?
Yes.

What will the interface be like for uploading photos/captions? How will that work?
Not sure yet. Thinking Google Spreadsheet
column10: data then fed to JSON file with a script. Need to discuss the photos: can use this if they can provide link to cropped photo
column11:
otherwise I will need to upload them to the server. Let's discuss.

Can we do a dry run deploy of it in production for New York Fashion Week so it's debut isn't on deadline on Emmy night? Fashion Week is 9/5-9/12.
Yes
column12: I will try to hit this deadline.\r\n"
